repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p:
A composite manuscript containing extracts of the Tivviyappirapantam, that is:
Tivviyappirapantam 2713-2717 (Indien 550a, U1).
Tivviyappirapantam 2673-2712 (Indien 550a, U2).
Tivviyappirapantam 2791-2900 (Indien 550b, U2).
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (November 2020).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

supportDesc.condition: Relatively poor state of preservation. Truncated, cracked folios.

additions.desc: Shelfmark in black in on a small hardpaper leaf tied at one end of the string: 36..
BnF register mark: R.C. 7881. (Indien 550a, U3, f[1]r).
BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 550 (Indien 550b, U1, f[1]r).
BnF register mark: R.C. 7881 (Indien 550b, U23, f10v).

binding.p: No woodcovers. Palm-leaf stop device at one end of the string.

acquisition.p: Acquired, December 18th, 1886, from M. Haas. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 2 = Acquisitions: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1893, no. 7881. — The composite was apparently created at the BnF as we find on both components the BnF register mark R.C. 7881.

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 76, no. 550.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 123r, no. 550.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.

revisionDesc.change: Revised by Emmanuel FRANCIS. Version 1, June 2022.
